attributes.comment:
Please remember that I-600 applicants are people adopting from another country.
Depending on the country, that process can take 24 months (or in some cases,
may be taking even longer). That means people often have to re-apply (and be
fingerprinted again), which means they must pay these fees twice. Given all of the
other expenses for adoption, this just increases the financial burden on families.

A possible solution that would resolve higher processing costs is to increase the
time an I-600 and associated fingerprint records are valid. This would reduce the
number of families reapplying after their documents have expired. It would have the
added benefit of effectively reducing costs for adoptive parents as they will not be
forced to pay the current fees ($545 + $70/adult family member) twice.

Thank you for your attention in this matter.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
